str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire. From kleronomos; to be an heir to.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Corruption, destruction, decay, rottenness, decomposition. From phtheiro; decay, i.e. Ruin.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire. From kleronomos; to be an heir to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aphthartos; incorruptibility; genitive, unending existence; genuineness.
